page.title: 06TRAFFIC SURVEY IN SEND
page.content: The junction of the A247/B318 at Mays Corner, inside the 30mph limit, is heavily used by children of all ages. There is one school crossing patrol. The heavy traffic on the main road is increased by parents collecting and dropping schoolchildren, by school coaches and by lorries turning into the B318 to a nearby sand pit depot. This junction is close to St. Bede's Middle School, whose pupils conducted a traffic census on 2 weekdays in 1984 between 8.30-9.00 and 15.15-15.45, 5 years after their previous survey. The figures showed the number of vehicles in the morning session is similar in 1984 to 1979, ie.total of 800+ in 30 minutes, near optimum number for the crossing. The afternoon figures showed a 20% increase. The main traffic flow had slightly increased in favour of the Woking direction.
